chapter.title: Introduction to Linux Containers
chapter.para: Linux container is a lightweight virtualization method to run multiple virtual units (containers, similar to the environment) simultaneously on a single host. Containers are isolated with kernel Control Groups () and kernel Namespaces.

Container provides an operating system level virtualization where the kernel controls the isolated containers. With other full virtualization solutions like &xen; or &kvm; the processor simulates a complete hardware environment and controls its s.

sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: Conceptually, container can be seen as an improved technique. The difference is that a environment separates only the file system, whereas container goes further and provides resource management and control via .
